firstScreen.body: The Museum needed a secure, off-site, cloud-accessible, and easily managed solution to protect its one-of-a-kind, irreplaceable footage. Storing the only master copy locally presented a high risk of losing all assets in the event of a data failure or system crash.
firstScreen.statBody: of data is safely stored and accessible for the Museum.

secondScreen.body: The Museum also needed assistance with physical storage for a collection of historical music artifacts.

thirdScreen.body: The former digital storage system was slow and inefficient, especially for remote access, which frustrated staff when they needed to retrieve content quickly.
thirdScreen.statBody: of existing footage of data migration from physical drives into Smart Vault.

firstScreen.body: With a focus on physical storage and a secure digital archive, Iron Mountain provided climate-controlled, private vaults for physical artifacts and implemented Smart Vault for digital preservation.
firstScreen.headline: A partnership with Iron Mountain

secondScreen.headline: Together, we:
numberedList: Digitized 786 video tapes (various formats like DVC pro, Beta SP, Mini DV)
Restored 33 hard drives (67 TB) featuring GRAMMY Award shows
Stored 1,000 cubic feet total of physical, historic assets in climate-controlled, private vaults

thirdScreen.headline: How Iron Mountain's digital preservation platform works:

main.body: The partnership with Iron Mountain secured the Museum's legacy, dramatically improving its preservation workflow and content accessibility for future generations.

bullets: Improved accessibility and security of the museum's assets
Simplified and made remote access efficient, allowing authorized users to access and distribute content quickly from anywhere
Post-production workflow includes automatic, immediate upload of footage to Smart Vault
diamondBenefits.label: Operational benefits

bullets: Enhanced licensing opportunities due to the ability to easily retrieve original, high-resolution content, including multiple camera angles
diamondBenefits.label: Economical benefits

bullets: Safely archived and protected unique performances against on-site disasters
Positioned the museum for future innovation through upcoming Smart Vault enhancements, including generative AI for advanced search capabilities
diamondBenefits.label: Strategic benefits

main.headline: Expanding possibilities

body: Assets, whether film, audio, digital, or physical, are logged, evaluated for condition and risk, and prioritized based on preservation and activation potential.
Physical media is digitized to archival standards, with restoration applied as needed and metadata extracted to ensure assets are searchable, playable, and accessible.
Iron Mountain's digital preservation platform provides a fully managed digital repository with triple-redundant geo-distributed storage, secure access, and intuitive navigation.
The entire archive becomes searchable through AI-powered metadata, custom filters, and integrated preview tools, enabling fast discovery from any location.
Digitized content is ready for licensing, streaming, and storytelling, unlocking new value across platforms while maintaining archival integrity.
